runs.comm: length outside off and Smith climbs into it, frees the arms and thrashes the ball over backward point, bounces away for a four first ball
slightly back of a length, at the body and Smith drops this down on to the pitch
cheeky from Smith, nicely place, opening the face to a length ball outside off, steering it up and away to third man
a genuine outside edge this time but that will be four more! Good line and length from Abbott, not quite there to drive but again the ball raises through vacant first slip
dug in short, flies over the crouching bastman
full and straight, there's an appeal from van Wyk but there might have been some bat involved before the ball thudded into the pads
"ooohs" around the ground as Gayle pushes tentatively at a length delivery, takes a thick chunk of outside edge and loops in front of point
shortish and pulled around the corner from back in the crease

length ball, Gayle backs away menacingly and baseball-bats the ball back at de Lange, who gets a hand on it and deflects to mid-off - Gayle was a bit lazy in trotting the single and was nearly run out by the direct hit
bosh, four more, flicked off the hips! Smith gets his fourth boundary, using de Lange's pace well, scoops the ball over midwicket and away

fullish and straight, Smith is caught on the crease - and up goes the finger! No footwork, he drove down the wrong line and was hit on the back pad, took a moment or two for the umpire to decide there was no bat involved but looked a good call
dug in short, down the leg side as the batsman ducks
short ball on off, Samuels backs away and carves up and over backward point for a couple ot get going
full toss from Abbott, Gayle seemed slow to pick it up and could only defend it
another low full toss, this time Gayle steps to leg and thumps wide of mid-off, who was scrambling to get down but couldn't cut it off
too full again, Abbott searching the blockhole but misses his mark, Gayle crunches this back straight, giving mid-off no chance
around the wicket, full toss, smashes through the off side! Three in a row from Gayle, he backed outside leg stump, knew exactly where this was going
four more, deja vu all over again for Abbott, wide of the stumps and slapped on the full through cover, one bounce into the crowd

and he finishes the over with a six! The mountain air is to Gayle's liking, this time a short ball from Abbott, he transfers his weight across to the off side and mullers it over deep midwicket. Punishing stuff
starts with a length ball around off stump, Samuels frees up his arms and dismissively smacks the ball back past mid-off for another boundary
loses his line down the leg side
length in the channel, aims a big swing down the ground but swipes fresh air
short ball, bounces more than Samuels expected and it bobbled back down the pitch
short of a length, slightly slower, Samuels gets on top of the bounce and taps one into the covers
banged in short, climbs on Samuels who swats at it, gets a bottom edge down behind the stumps
overpitched, a cutter on middle and leg, bullied back down the ground... all the way! Wiese lets out a scream of frustration, Samuels struck that so sweetly
superb start to the big man, full and quick on leg stump, Gayle gets his feet out of the way but can only block it
ooh er, not so good this time, short and inviting, Gayle pulls it from outside off out towards deep midwicket on the bounce
goes full and on the legs again but this time Gayle manages to get under it, swats the ball to the same part of the ground with a brutal heave
nice response from de Lange, a fast bouncer that Gayle fails to get bat on
rolls the fingers over this one, short again and veering away from Gayle - wide
length ball on the stumps and this is mercilessly slapped into the stands at deep midwicket, Gayle rumbles on regardless
another good bouncer, 145+kph and Gayle swings and misses again
overpitched, on middle and leg, Samuels picks it up and lazily swings the ball back down the ground for six more. Steam coming off these two
steps away, full toss from Samuels, he's not in a good position to play it but manages to squirt a thick edge past the man on the fine to long leg for another boundary
length outside off from Wiese now, Samuels nearly swings himself off his feet, thickish edge but it flies beyond backward point
good comeback, rolls his fingers over it, swing and a miss on off stump
drop short and Samuels' hands are like lightning, rocks the weight back and hammers a pull through square leg for four more
length on off stump, steps away and cuts towards point - a precious dot for SA
flighted, Gayle gets to the pitch and cracks a low slog-sweep along the ground to midwicket, where du Plessis tumbles to stop it smartly
tossed up on the stumps and Gayle larrups this with the spin away through square leg for yet another four
shorter length, rocks back and pulls, one hand off the bat
tossed up, Samuels closes the face and pushes back down the ground
clubbed away on the full in front of midwicket, du Plessis cuts if off again
drops a little short and wide, Samuels cuts off the back foot, there's a good diving stop from Abbott at point
floated up, Gayle advances and punches one back past the bowler
pushed through flat on off stump, Samuels drives with a high follow-through to long-off
scuttles in from around the wicket, full toss from Tahir and Gayle wallops it down the ground dismissively - that's his 50, from 20 balls. A full three balls slower than the other night
tosses up the googly, spins away from Gayle's prod, outside the tramlines
full again, bunted into the covers
pushed through and Gayle punches back to the off side, Tahir makes a sprawling stop of his own bowling
length ball spinning in from outside off, Gayle crunches a back-foot cut to cover
pushed on in the channel outside off, width for Samuels but he can't beat point with a cut
flat trajectory, skidding on, finds a gap in the covers
goes over the wicket to the left-hander, serves Gayle a juicy half-tracker ... You know what comes next. Swing, ding, out of the ring, high over deep backward square
full and crumped back down the ground, such power in those arms, there are two men back but neither is getting there

down on one knee, this goes the distance too! Huge swing of the arms, hitting with the turn and making Phangiso wish he's taken up golf as a youngster, Gayle lands this on the green among the giddy spectators at deep midwicket
tossed up a bit slower, tries to go for the slog-sweep again but this time fails to connect
googly from Tahir, comes forward and punches down the ground
full, dug out into the leg side, they'll have to be quick but Samuels is
tossed up, Samuels skips out and bunts one more down the ground
another googly and Gayle reaches out, swats it into the top tier of the stand! This is an exhibition
comes forward, punches one to long-on
pushed through outside off, throws the bat and gets an inside edge to the leg side
tossed up on the off stump, very nicely driven through extra-cover, long-off is around to save, and has his leg on the rope when he flicked the ball back, great timing on the shot
gorgeous, too wide line and stroked through cover, timing so good again, picked the gap, no sweeper back
another nice drive but this is straight to long-off
firm drive from off stump down to long-off
low full toss but only smashed down to long-on, thankfully for Samuels on the bounce
another full toss, blasted down the ground for a flat six inside long-off, great end to the over for the Windies
excellent yorker on off stump, Samuels gets a tickle on it, deliberately played, fine of third man, really nicely played having watched a replay
straighter line this time, tucked too close to long leg for a second
low full toss just outside off, Gayle just leans on it and lets the massive bat do the rest, it pings off like a golf ball being struck and flies past extra cover wide of the sweeper
bumper, right on line, Gayle drops his hands on it, went through chest-high
yorker on leg stump, dug out to deep square
full on the off stump, just dropped back to the bowler
googly which keeps low, beats Gayle outside off but skips under the keeper's legs and rushes away for four byes
line down leg, helped on it's way backward of square, fine enough for a second
off stump line, pressed back to the bower, a cheer for the dot ball
smeared out with a slog sweep to deep midwicket, not too far short of the fielder, bowler screamed catch
leg stump line, tucked in front of short long leg and that's Samuels' fifty, he's played superbly well
slog swept off leg stump, missed, it pops up off the pad and van Wyk takes the catch, huge cry for a bat-pad but not out given, replay shows no glove involved at all
back of a length, Samuels backs away to leg and cuts hard past backward point, great shot
sends this on a tighter line and it takes the pad to the keeper
low full toss, chipped down the ground wide of long-on, 150 partnership raised from 74 balls
around the wicket, full but much too wide of off stump

slower ball outside off, Gayle presses at it and nicks it behind! Could be a huge moment in the game. Gayle trying to carve the cutter past short third man but just nicked it to the keeper's left and he clung on for dear life, ends a thrilling innings
full on the off stump, driven firmly on the bounce over the bowler
short ball, whacked leg side, mistimed on the ground out towards deep square
just outside off, pleasantly driven wide enough of long-off and they get back for a second, the running should be better now Gayle's out!
turns well wide of off stump but Samuels leans out to cut to point
forward pressing down to long-off
full toss, slapped down the ground but not far enough inside long-on for a second
googly, only defended back to the bowler
they do, full ball knocked up into the covers

length on the stumps, Samuels steps away to leg and tries to swing it over the leg side, doesn't get enough on it and picks out long-on! Poor stroke really, couldn't find the gap, nor get enough elevation on it and it was a straightforward catch. Good knock from Samuels but he can't go on having lost Gayle
back of a length, tried to be flicked leg side, runs off the thigh pad inside short third man
low full toss, turned out to deep square
length just outside off, Pollard aims leg side and gets a thick outside edge over short third man, pretty lucky
big ballooning bumper miles over the batsman's head

slower ball, slapped leg side, it's gone straight up, Behardien comes tearing in from long-on and takes the catch! Another wicket falls. Total miscue off a big top edge, the slower ball does the trick, solid catch taken
full on the stumps, clipped down to long-on
length wide of off stump, slapped down the ground and excellent running brings a second
pitched up on the stumps and smashed over midwicket ! Biggest strike for a while, heaved into the terraces, Abbott misses the yorker and gets punished
further outside off and steered wide of short third man, lovely batting, stroked away with an open face

full toss outside off slapped straight to long-off! Deary me. Poor ball, powerfully slapped down the ground but couldn't have picked the fielder out better. Just when Russell looked to have really got set
yorker just outside off, pressed forward at and missed
wide on the crease, full wide of off stump, driven at and not quite as well steered as Russell managed, more of an outside edge but against past a diving short third man, 200 up
just outside off, cut hard and a great save at backward point by Wiese, would have been for, placed well and struck well by Sammy
full on the stumps, goes to flick leg side and misses, struck on the pads
length ball heaved leg side, has he got it all? Yes! Over the rope again, the big boundary over midwicket

low full toss, swung down the ground and finds the fielder! Another full toss gets a wicket, miscue looking to go off side but got it too straight and not far enough, simple catch well held at long-off
another low full toss, clipped out towards deep midwicket, fielder charges in to save the second
full on the stumps, turned through square leg
whoops, well wide of off
full toss just outside off, tried to slap it down the ground but gets a thick inside edge past the stumps to the fine leg fence! So lucky for the batsman, it shaved leg stump
yorker length wide of off stump, carved straight to backward point, singles are okay for South Africa
full and wide, absolutely blitzed away on the off side and it races past the cover sweeper, half-volley in the end and long-handled away, lands just inside the rope
low full toss, clipped away through square leg and four more! Helped on it's way nicely, Sammy with a fist-pump
tries to smash it leg side again, gets a thick inside edge from outside off through midwicket and they sprint back for a second, Sammy home with a dive
full ball fiercely struck down the ground, long-off can't save the second
length ball just outside off, dabbed down to third man
low full toss, swung over square leg and that's the game in thrilling fashion!!
